data.title: Cannot import a PNG as an Image
data.body:
Godot 3.0 master
Windows 10 64 bits

I am trying to import an image in my project to be used in GDScript, not in rendering.
However, I can't figure out how to make Godot import it as an `Image`, there doesn't seem to be any choice in the import settings:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1311555/29776987-c0c1bb2e-8c0a-11e7-9299-aadc876e7d53.png)

data.title: When indenting code, Godot crashes because of expected indentation
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot 2.1.3 stable official, Antergos Linux x86_64, 4.12.8-2-ARCH

**Issue description:**
I added an inbuilt script to a viewport node and copied over the size and stretch override code example from [Godot's docs](https://godot.readthedocs.io/en/stable/learning/features/viewports/viewports.html#doc-viewports) inside the _ready()

It would be copied over unindented as so:
```
extends Viewport

func _ready():
viewport.set_size_override(w,h) #custom size for 2D
viewport.set_size_override_stretch(true/false) #enable stretch for custom size
```

And then, if I indented both lines of code as such:

```
extends Viewport

func _ready():
    viewport.set_size_override(w,h) #custom size for 2D
    viewport.set_size_override_stretch(true/false) #enable stretch for custom size
```

Godot will crash. This does not just apply to the viewport node, but to any node, it seems, as I tried it out on a panel node as well and it led to a crash.


P.S: For some reason, Godot's editor didn't allow code to be copied from it :/

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a node. Attach a script. Copy/paste the aforementioned code from the Godot docs into the _ready() function and, sometimes without saving, Godot will crash.

THIS DOES NOT HAPPEN IF THE CODE IS WRITTEN BY HAND. (Edit: ok nvm this bit - it's because when writing by hand I didn't include the true/false division argument to the size_override_stretch function...)

data.title: Duplicated 'script_changed' signal on ScriptEditorBase (b20952e)
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot Master branch

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Error occurs: `Type ScriptEditorBase already has signal: script_changed`

`script_changed` is of `Object` class.

Regression since b20952eb

https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/b20952ebfff216acc07f6bbcad35b5a1e97a310c/editor/plugins/script_editor_plugin.cpp#L49

data.title: Adds Object::emits_signal
Dragging an image from the resource pane to the 2d workspace results in a bad resource link
data.body:
In the current revision in the repo, dragging any image from the resource pane to the 2d workspace (possibly any workspace) results in a resource path of for example; "res://some_image.png". 
It should be automatically be setting the resource to the "res://.import/some_image-8234823498234.stex" file behind the scenes but it doesn't.

Manually creating a Sprite->Adding a streaming texture->Loading the "some_image.png" will create the right links on the scene.

data.title: Can't save project settings (regression from 565600e)
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Any OS, Godot master (8fce79a)

**Issue description:**
As reported by @kurikaesu, saving project settings does not work, the following error is displayed:
```
core/object.cpp:1070 - Error calling method from signal ‘property_edited’: ‘ProjectSettingsEditor::_settings_changed’: Method expected 0 arguments, but called with 1.
```

> ProjectSettingsEditor::_settings_changed is defined with no method arguments
but the signal ‘property_edited’ provides a ‘property’ value as the first argument

It's a regression from 565600e8445a3073e4188a1a2bde1f47dd299c5a where I removed `ProjectSettingsEditor::_settings_prop_edited(const String &p_name)` which appeared to be useless: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/565600e8445a3073e4188a1a2bde1f47dd299c5a#diff-4ff2c2c3d2b51423bf963d3ab9e3daf2L885

But this error shows that it served the purpose of satisfying the argument of the `property_edited` signal, so it should be added back: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/565600e8445a3073e4188a1a2bde1f47dd299c5a#diff-4ff2c2c3d2b51423bf963d3ab9e3daf2L1481

data.title: Android custom build debugging failed
data.body:
Windows 7 Gotdot 3.0 Aplha (committed around 8/26-8/27)

Android template has no errors while compiling. The debug version of game fail to be opened. I found that I missed a brace in the .java, and it shew no errors. After compiling again, it still stopped working on my phone.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create an Android modules (may not required).
2. Compile the Android template. (no errors)
3. Debug the game and it will stop working.

*Not project specific.

**Crash report:**
https://pastebin.com/QceruiYN

data.title: Godot freezes with "Interface -> Custom Font" set
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 10, Godot 3.

**Issue description:**
A daily build of Godot from around a week ago broke the custom fonts (the global UI font - NOT the text editor font).

This seems to be related to the script editor, because the Godot window freezes (not responding) as soon as I open any script - while having a custom font for the UI.

data.title: `gdnative-generate-json-api` doesn't work
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version:**
OS: Windows 10 x64
Godot version: 3.0 (8fce79aaeef3788bed170f07fc728e25f66e4a20)

**Issue description:**
Launching godot executable with "--gdnative-generate-json-api api.json" doesn't produce json file with api.
Output:
```
>godot.windows.tools.64.exe --gdnative-generate-json-api api.json

Activated GL 3.3 contextOpenGL ES 3.0 Renderer: Intel(R) HD Graphics 4600
GLES3: max ubo light: 409
GLES3: max ubo reflections: 455, ubo size: 144
ERROR: No loader found for resource: res://api.json
   At: core\io\resource_loader.cpp:223
ERROR: Failed loading scene: res://api.json
   At: main\main.cpp:1456
WARNING: ObjectDB::cleanup: ObjectDB Instances still exist!
     At: core\object.cpp:1996
```

Issue seems to appear after commits 3d1c03187132677800b7f6bc609eeef8fe51f315 and 36e0a72c77348d4a1f2195937dff8dba88f7e044.
Before these two commits (at 21d53f29f392f4a33095de75c478da345a362555) everything worked fine.

data.title: Some variables not shown in debugger
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**

Windows 10, Godot 2.1.4 stable, i7, GeForce GTX 1080

**Issue description:**

After setting a breakpoint in the debugger, only one of two variables in a script is shown. Which variable is shown changes between different runs of the script, but one of them is always missing.

**Steps to reproduce:**

Create a new project. Add a panel and a button as child of the panel. Attach the following script to the panel:

```
extends Panel

var _foo = null
var _bar = null

func _handle_button_press():
	if _foo == null:
		_foo = "foo"
		_bar = "bar"
	else:
		_foo = null
		_bar = null

func _ready():
	get_node("Button").connect("pressed", self, "_handle_button_press")
```
Set a breakpoint on the line `if foo == null:` and run the project. The debugger shows either `_foo` or `_bar`, not both.


**Link to minimal example project:**

[DebuggerTest01.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1255006/DebuggerTest01.zip)

data.title: [3D view] selected object is not obvious
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot 3

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
While working with 3d models it is quite hard to distinguish selected object from the rest, because currently only bounding box is showed; I suggest showing outline for the selected 3d object.

As an addition, I also propose adding functionality to set mimap level for the background, so that in viewport the user can see blurred version- that helps to focus on the 3d objects by reducing visual noise in the scene.

![godot_3d_original](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9309589/29755933-1cfaccd8-8b97-11e7-9484-271be9d34ca2.jpg)
![godot_3d_suggestion](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9309589/29755934-1cfc4d06-8b97-11e7-85b5-87f0cdf261e0.jpg)

data.title: Fix a crash in gdscript callbacks
data.body: This fixes a crash running the 'goltorus' project.

data.title: gltf importer: AO and metallic channels are reversed on import
data.body:
According to their [docs](https://github.com/KhronosGroup/glTF-Blender-Exporter/blob/master/docs/user.md#substance-painter), ambient occlusion is placed in red and metallic is placed in blue channel of AO-Roughness-Metallic texture.

When Godot imports a gltf scene created by khronos exporter, these channels are reversed.

data.body: :wave:

data.title: Play Edited Scene overwrites scene in first tab
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot 3 bd282ff43f23fe845f29a3e25c8efc01bd65ffb0
MacOS 10.12.6

**Issue description:**
I wanted to play the current edited scene, but the editor saved the current scene over my previous scene.


**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a project with multiple scenes
2. Open a scene, press the Play Edited Scene button
3. Open another scene while leaving the first one opened as well in a tab
4. With the 2nd scene active in the tabs, press the "Play Edited Scene" button again.
5. After the scene plays, Godot has replaced my 1st scene with the 2nd one. (seems like this happens only for the first tab, also notice the error in the Output panel when closing the last tab)

**GIF of the whole process**
![godot3_weird_scene_mixup_2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/570771/29753580-7aab7b7a-8b74-11e7-823e-e03bb10511e0.gif)


**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
[Godot3FirstGame.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1254696/Godot3FirstGame.zip)

data.title: Subsurface Scatter issues
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Fedora 26, bd282ff43f23fe845f29a3e25c8efc01bd65ffb0, Nvidia Proprietary driver 384.59

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Enabling Subsurf scatter makes the screen white on old projects and does not seem to have effect on new projects on both cases spams the console with this message:
```
   At: drivers/gles3/rasterizer_gles3.cpp:122.
ERROR: _gl_debug_print: GL ERROR: Source: OpenGL	Type: Error	ID: 1282Severity: High	Message: GL_INVALID_OPERATION error generated. No active program.
```

This is on an old project, it used to be good, but now the SS causes the mentioned problem.
![peek 2017-08-27 13-56](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1103897/29753085-9d0cb4b2-8b2f-11e7-8720-538480f7e957.gif)

these are on new projects, created with the mentioned version.
![screenshot from 2017-08-27 14-06-40](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1103897/29753225-31738a3e-8b32-11e7-8325-d7663dab973c.png)
![screenshot from 2017-08-27 14-14-09](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1103897/29753226-31959840-8b32-11e7-80ee-eea00f3a357d.png)



**Steps to reproduce:**
Just set a SS on a material, by default you will get this
![screenshot from 2017-08-27 14-06-40](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1103897/29753165-f7ceda1e-8b30-11e7-951e-a77e63b2388d.png)

data.title: Autocomplete behaviour
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Linux 64 bits Godot [bd282ff](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/bd282ff43f23fe845f29a3e25c8efc01bd65ffb0)

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
if you delete a line and the cursor lands on a word in the next line, if you delete characters in the middle of a word and if you uncomment a line while your cursor is on a word the autocomplete popup will show.

**Steps to reproduce:**
little animated GIFs that demonstrates the behaviour:

- deleting a line
![deleting a line](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/410751/29797093-1b5d62d0-8c4d-11e7-94f0-43a6cc2b5ba8.gif)

- uncomment a line
![uncommenting a line](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/410751/29797107-37461b9a-8c4d-11e7-8af3-64f49e1a9c12.gif)

- editing middle of word
![middle of word](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/410751/29797115-45f7afbe-8c4d-11e7-8763-e6b3241d19c0.gif)


What other editors do is something like (using qtcreator as an example):

- deleting a line
![deleting a line](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/410751/29797622-2f33a442-8c50-11e7-8a2a-389f1e74e67b.gif)

- uncomment a line
![uncommenting a line](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/410751/29797629-35e5ced2-8c50-11e7-9896-78472f5e93d4.gif)

- editing middle of word
![middle of word](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/410751/29797640-4afa8f9c-8c50-11e7-9cdf-ca12a3242262.gif)

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: shader parameters accessible from shader inspector instead of material
data.body:
Usability discussion.

Doesn't it make more sense to have the shader parameters accessible when the shader tab is open? At the moment you're forced to go back and forth between shader and and material to set the parameters. If you have factors to play with it's a pain to go back an forth like that, since the shader code editor closes.

So we have 2 options:
1. move the shader parameters under shader in inspector
2. don't automatically close the shader code editor when moving in the inspector & scene from shader to other resources/objects

I'd be happy with either, but I don't know the implications here.

data.title: Fixed offset view when removing text, issue 10529
data.body:
Fixed offset view when removing text.

closes #10529 

Side note: My 100th PR :cake:!

data.title: Added new WASAPI driver for Windows
data.body:
This implements a new audio driver using WASAPI (Shared Mode) for Windows.
Needs testing but so far it worked fine for me.
It should give a better latency compared to the RtAudio DirectSound one, again, needs testing.
Also this driver can support surround sound, but needs #10568 before I can support it here.

data.title: Only start autocomplete when next character is empty or a space.
data.body:
Just for discussion, do not commit.

*bugsquad node:* This is intended to solve #10695.

data.title: Replace default editor font to NotoSansUI
data.body:
Fix #10076, #5647

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8281454/29751651-36fc2250-8b8b-11e7-8495-1927549df4d9.png)


**Look carefully at the name of a project.**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8281454/29751680-801ae750-8b8b-11e7-8d26-ec3083aeb221.png)
Latin letter's baseline is not same with others.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8281454/29751691-95bb787c-8b8b-11e7-8893-1442c110140b.png)
It's corrected with NotoSansUI-Regular.ttf instead of DroidSans.
And looks better.

without this change https://github.com/godotengine/godot/compare/2.1...volzhs:editor-font?expand=1#diff-0f2d5f8b708eeeac121058c71f5c1428R88
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8281454/29751695-a24891ec-8b8b-11e7-9543-39f9218e8425.png)
window title label position is wrong.
